text: I feel like I'm on a bit of a diner soup
kick these days first I made chicken
noodle soup and now I'm making a great
and fast version of mushroom barley soup
it's faster because I'm using quick
cooking barley which only takes about
ten minutes to cook instead of about 50
minutes I'm starting off by cutting ten
ounces of button mushroom into slices
it's one package they usually come in
the ten ounce packages and you could
replace these regular white mushrooms
with cremini mushrooms or a combination
of other mushrooms if you wanted to or
had access to them go right ahead
now we can start cooking heat a medium
stockpot and then add two tablespoons of
unsalted butter in a saute all your
ingredients won't take very long at all
I'd two cloves of minced garlic and one
diced onion as well as a teaspoon of dry
thyme if you're using fresh you'll want
to double it so do two teaspoons of
fresh thyme cook it until your onions
are a little bit translucent that
shouldn't take too long a couple minutes
is probably plenty mmm
smelling fragrant already I'm gonna add
some salt and pepper just another minute
or so add your mushrooms and you want to
cook these down too you want to release
some of their juices and intensify the
flavors to cook them for about eight
minutes or so until a lot of that
moisture pulls out you'll see what it
looks like they get a little bit golden
brown they start being really squeaky
which I find really annoying you'll see
hate that squeaking sound somebody tell
me why it makes a hideous squeaking
sound but it may be making annoying
squeaking sounds but it smells
I guess you got to take the good with
the bad huh once your mushrooms have
cooked down you can add your cooking
liquid I'm using four cups of homemade
or low-sodium chicken broth and I almost
always combine my store-bought stocked
with water because it has a tendency to
be a little salty so if you were using
homemade you could use a hundred percent
stock if you wanted to and you could
certainly make this vegetable broth if
you wanted it to be vegetarian add one
ounce of dried shiitake mushrooms full
of amazing flavor this is really gonna
intensify the mushroom flavor bring this
to a boil reduce it to a simmer and cook
until all the mushrooms are tender
that'll take about 12 minutes when your
soup is simmered for 12 minutes you can
add your barley the quick-cooking barley
will only take about 10 to 15 minutes to
cook if you were using the longer
cooking barley you would definitely need
to cook it a lot longer it takes about
50 minutes for pearl barley to cook
which is a lot longer than the quick
cooking some people have told me it's a
little hard for them to find a quick
cooking and this will definitely work
with the pearl barley just give it a
little bit more time and it is done you
guys take a look at that it's chock full
of goodness quick cooking barley made it
SuperDuper fast hearty fragrant
fall friendly diner soup at home in 30
minutes
don't bring your gun
you
